title: Free-body diagrams - three ropes pulling a ring

content.question: A ring is being pulled by three ropes in different directions in a horizontal plane. The magnitude and direction of each force exerted on the ring is represented in the diagram. Which of the following correctly describes the direction, if any, of the sum of the force vectors exerted on the ring within the plane shown?

choices.label: The sum of the force vectors is zero.
The sum of the force vectors is in the <math alttext="positive x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></math>-direction.
The sum of the force vectors is in the <math alttext="positive y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi></math>-direction.

The sum of the force vectors has components in both the <math alttext="positive x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></math>-direction and the <math alttext="positive y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi></math>-direction.

content.answer: The sum of the force vectors has components in both the <math alttext="positive x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></math>-direction and the <math alttext="positive y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi></math>-direction.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
